title: Walter Tracy
content:
**[Indicies](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indicies) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Walter Tracy**

1914–1995  
English

Typesetter, typographer, designer, author, and typeface designer. Wrote [Letters of Credit](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Letters%20of%20Credit) in 1986.

From 1948 through 1978, he worked at [Linotype and Machinery](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype%20and%20Machinery), the English Linotype company. There, he designed the following typefaces: [Jubilee](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jubilee), Adsans, Maximus, Telegraph Modern, Times Europa, and Doric.

After retiring, he worked on Telegraph Newface Bold, [Qadi](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Qadi), [Kufics](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kufics), Oasis, [Sharif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Sharif), [Malik](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010202129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Malik), and Medina (most of these are Arabic typefaces). Tracy became something of an expert on Arabic typeface design.
author: dan_reynolds
